Class GeneralLedger

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeneralLedger

        public GeneralLedger()
        brief: This method is the constructor for the GeneralLedger class. It instantiates a ledger with 50 (the value of MAX_TRANSACTIONS) elements.

    • Method Detail

      • getLedger

        public Transaction[] getLedger()
        brief: This method is provided in order to access the GeneralLedger.
        Returns:
        Transaction[]: It returns the GeneralLedger, which is an array of Transaction objects.

      • getTotalDebitAmount

        public double getTotalDebitAmount()
        brief: This method gives the totalDebitAmount, which keeps track of the amount of deposits in Jack's account.
        Returns:
        double: The double returned is the value of totalDebitAmount, which has private access in the GeneralLedger class.

      • setTotalDebitAmount

        public void setTotalDebitAmount(double d)
        brief: This method sets the totalDebitAmount, which keeps track of the amount of deposits in Jack's account.
        Parameters:
        d - double: This double is the desired amount to set the totalDebitAmount to.

      • getTotalCreditAmount

        public double getTotalCreditAmount()
        brief: This method gives the totalCreditAmount, which keeps track of the amount of credits (or withdrawals) in Jack's account.
        Returns:
        double: The double returned is the value of totalCreditAmount, which has private access in the GeneralLedger class.

      • setTotalCreditAmount

        public void setTotalCreditAmount(double d)
        brief: This method sets the totalCreditAmount, which keeps track of the amount of credits (or withdrawals) in Jack's account.
        Parameters:
        d - double: This double is the desired amount to set the totalCreditAmount to.

      • addTransaction

        public void addTransaction(Transaction newTransaction)
                    throws FullGeneralLedgerException,
                           InvalidTransactionException,
                           TransactionAlreadyExistsException
        brief: This method takes a transaction argument and adds it to the General Ledger based on its date. It contains several iterative if-statements to keep the array sorted.
        Parameters:
        newTransaction: - the Transaction created based upon the user's input for its date, amount and description
        Throws:
        FullGeneralLedgerException - This exception is thrown if the General Ledger already contains 50 elements. 50 is the max number of elements that the General Ledger can hold.
        InvalidTransactionException - This exception is thrown if the date of the Transaction object passed to the method is invalid, or if the amount of the transaction object is equal to 0.
        TransactionAlreadyExistsException - This exception is thrown if the user is attempting to add a Transaction to the GeneralLedger that is already there.

      • removeTransaction

        public void removeTransaction(int position)
                       throws InvalidLedgerPositionException
        brief: This method supplies the corresponding arguments to the deleteElement method. It ensures that the position value is legitimate (i.e. greater than the number of Transactions in the General Ledger and not less than 1), it sets the totalDebitAmount and totalCreditAmount to the correct values, i.e. subtracts the amount of the Transaction from the corresponding value.
        Parameters:
        position: - integer value representing the position in General Ledger to be deleted. The method removeTransaction supplies a value of position-1 to the deleteElement method, because the array is 0-indexed.
        Throws:
        InvalidLedgerPositionException - This exception is thrown if there is no element in the General Ledger at the given position, or if the position given is less than 1 or greater than 50.

      • deleteElement

        public static void deleteElement(Transaction[] t,
                                 int n)
        brief: This method essentially moves all elements that are to the right of the desired element to the left, replacing the space left behind.
        Parameters:
        t: - the array of Transaction items for the deletion to be performed upon, in this case the GeneralLedger
        n: - the index (in the array) of the Transaction to be deleted

      • getTransaction

        public Transaction getTransaction(int position)
                           throws InvalidLedgerPositionException
        brief: This method returns the Transaction object located at the given position in the GeneralLedger.
        Parameters:
        position: - This parameter is used to determine which element to retrieve from the General Ledger. Since arrays are 0-indexed, when working with the array itself, the value of position must be decremented by 1.
        Returns:
        Transaction: The value returned by this method is the Transaction located at the given location in the GeneralLedger.
        Throws:
        InvalidLedgerPositionException - This exception is thrown if the position passed by the user is either greater than the number of elements in the GeneralLedger, or less than 1.

      • filter

        public static void filter(GeneralLedger generalLedger,
                          java.lang.String date)
        brief: This method searches through the GeneralLedger to find the Transaction objects with the same date value as the parameter.
        Parameters:
        generalLedger: - This parameter is the GeneralLedger (array of Transaction objects) to search through.
        date: - This parameter is the date value (given as a String) that is to be searched for in the General Ledger.

      • clone

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        brief: This method creates an identical instance of the given GeneralLedger object, but it is a deep copy and therefore has a different memory address from the original. Subsequent changes to the original GeneralLedger will NOT affect this new GeneralLedger.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Object: This method returns a generic object, which must be casted to a GeneralLedger in order to access its contents.

      • exists

        public boolean exists(Transaction transaction)
               throws IllegalArgumentException
        brief: This method iterates through the GeneralLedger and determines whether or not the Transaction object passed by the parameter is inside.
        Parameters:
        transaction: - This parameter is the Transaction object that is to be found in the GeneralLedger.
        Returns:
        boolean (same): This boolean is the return of the exists method. If the transaction object has been found, the value returned is true.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - This exception is thrown if any values passed to the Transaction object are invalid.

      • size

        public int size()
        brief: This method simply returns the numElements integer, which keeps track of how many Transactions are contained in the GeneralLedger.
        Returns:
        int: The integer return tells how many Transactions are in the GeneralLedger.

      • printAllTransactions

        public void printAllTransactions()
        brief: This method simply prints the top of the table to format the printed Transactions, and calls the toString method for the GeneralLedger.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        brief: This method concatenates a String which accounts for each Transaction in the GeneralLedger and formats each Transaction individually in the table.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Throwable

      • moveTransactions

        public void moveTransactions(Transaction t,
                             int track)
        brief: This is a helper method for the addTransactions method. It shifts elements to the right in order to leave space for the newTransaction.
        Parameters:
        t: - This parameter is the Transaction object that is to be added to the GeneralLedger.
        track: - This parameter is the index in the array where the newTransaction is to be placed.
